posts.name: Jayden
posts.cooked: Heya folks, me again.  Hope y’all are having a great day.  So, me and my team are at that stage of pathplanner commands and plan to use a sensor for a named command. However, we are unsure of how we are to go about this. Our question, to put simply, how would we cancel a named command once a certain condition has been met? Like calling a command but the named command ends when a sensor detects a color? Thank you for taking the time to read this and hope you have a great rest of your day.

.until

Individual commands are capable of accomplishing a large variety of robot tasks, but the simple three-state format can quickly become cumbersome when more advanced functionality requiring extended ...

link_counts.title: Command Compositions — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Tom Line
posts.cooked: Use an if statement in the execute portion of your command using whatever condition you like.  Set “m_isFinished=true” in that if statement.  The command will end when it sees m_isFinished as “true”.

posts.name: Jayden
posts.cooked:
Heya, thanks for the response but I am slightly confused on how to create an end command. Do you mind reviewing me and my team’s code? Thanks and have a great rest of your day.

Contribute to CyberTitan-Coders/2024RobotCode development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Jayden
posts.cooked: Sorry question clarification. Here we have written some very simple detection code

posts.name: Jayden
posts.cooked:
Then we call call it into a command and in robot container like this:

public void registerNamedCommands(){ NamedCommands.registerCommand(“Detect Color”, new DetectNoteColor(m_intake, Constants.IntakeShooter.kIntakeSpeed)); } }

How would we implement it like the example to do this: button.onTrue(command.until(m_limitSwitch::get)); without the button

(sorry if I am overthinking this)

posts.name: Aaron Huang
posts.cooked: I would use a parallel race or deadline group within pathplanner autos to achieve this. If this is not for a auto you can programmatically use the same command groups.
